description: A recipe for making Pain Au Chocolat with a focus on health and well-being.
ingredients: [{"name": "Strong Flour", "units": "g", "amount": 1000}, {"name": "Water", "units": "g", "amount": 630}, {"name": "Salt", "units": "g", "amount": 20}, {"name": "Fresh Yeast", "units": "g", "amount": 60}, {"name": "Sugar", "units": "g", "amount": 60}, {"name": "Trimoline", "units": "g", "amount": 40}, {"name": "S500", "units": "g", "amount": 10}, {"name": "Sapore Baiota", "units": "g", "amount": 30}, {"name": "Belcolade CacaoPowder CP1Cacao-Trace", "units": "g", "amount": 120}, {"name": "Mimetic CL", "units": "g", "amount": 500}, {"name": "Chocolate Filling", "units": "g", "amount": 490}, {"name": "Sugar Syrup", "units": "g", "amount": 30}, {"name": "Water", "units": "g", "amount": 30}]
instructions: 1. Set aside 40g of cocoa powder and 40g of water. At the end of mixing, take out 450g of dough and mix with cocoa powder and water to create a darker shade of brown. Mix until 100%, flatten and keep until the end of lamination for the bicolor method. 2. Mixing: 5 minutes speed 1, 4 minutes speed 2. 3. Dough temperature: 16°C. 4. Cool to -18°C for 1 hour. 5. Lamination: 2 double folds (16 layers). Place the colored layer on top before cooling again to 4°C. 6. Scaling: 70 grams. 7. Cool to 4°C for 30 minutes. 8. Final lamination: Roll out to a block of 37cm width by 129cm length, make incisions with a grid cutter on the colored layer and cut rectangles of 18cm length by 8cm width. Insert 7g of chocolate filling, fold, insert another 7g and roll. 9. Final proofing: 2 hours at 31°C and 85% humidity. 10. Baking: Convection oven at 190°C top and bottom for 17 minutes.
